pages.text: The $(marked)Basic Rite Materials$() are used in recipes and rites, and are dedicated to the five primal elements. $(br)They can also be found across the world, like many other rite materials.
$(item)Purest Water$() is, well, pretty pure water. Drinking it will remove all bad potion effects
$(item)Living Sparks$() roar the passion of the fire.$(br)They may not glow forever, but their heat will never cease.
$(item)Pure Earth$() is fine in the hand but hard on the ground. The skin always stays clean after touching it, and no smell is left.
$(item)Captured Motion$() is frozen in place, but not in time. Touching it feels like a gust of wind, moving it feels like walking fast.

$(item)Stardust$() is stardust. It is the rotten blood of suns. $(br)It is us. It is a name, and it is space, partially, as what is without is just as within. $(br)But this is pretty much the opposite of $(item)Glowstone Dust$()... and the same, of course, for occult paradox shenanigans.
